name: Descendant combination
description:
The **descendant combination selector** selects every element with the type of e.g. `F` which has as parent an element with the element type of `E` through `>>` between both elements to have a visible, non-whitespace descendant selector form.
[info]CSS1 introduced this selector through whitespace: [`descendant combination selector`](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css1/descendant-combination/ 'CSS1: Descendant Combination').[/info]
example_description: This example will add a green `background-color` with a white `color` to every `<span>` which has a `<div>` as parent.
